data.event: Originally settled in the 1830s, Bellevue was incorporated in 1855 and is the oldest continuous town in Nebraska.

event.title: is located at an elevation of 1159

data.event: Bellevue is located at an elevation of 1159 ft (353 m).
Settlement of what became Bellevue began when a fur trading post was built in 1822 by Joshua Pilcher, then president of the Missouri Fur Company based in St. Louis.
The post was later known as Fontenelle's Post after being run by Lucien Fontenelle, a fur trader who purchased it in 1828 to represent the American Fur Company.
